title: Serbians hold mass protest against government
description: Tens of thousands of people protested on Saturday against the government in Belgrade, in the latest rally since 18 people were killed in mass shootings.

title: A dozen civilians die in Burkina Faso attack
description: Suspected jihadists attacked the village of Sara, 100 kilometers from Burkina's second city Bobo-Dioulasso, on the night of Friday to Saturday, security sources said.

title: Putin meets with African leaders in Russia to discuss Ukraine peace plan
description: Seven African leaders traveled to St. Petersburg on Saturday to meet with Putin who was attending Russia's showpiece international economic forum. But the meeting ended with no visible progress.

title: 'War or Peace?': Writter Mikhail Shishkin shatters the Russian lie
description: In a collection of essays both intimate and historical, Shishkin dreams of seeing another Russia rise from the ashes.

title: French police and protesters briefly clash over Lyon-Turin rail tunnel project
description: Three thousand people demonstrated in the French Alps against the construction of a new high-speed train line between France and Italy, saying it will wreck a sensitive environment.

title: Paris museum reopens permanent exhibit recounting diverse experiences of immigrants
description: The National Museum of the History of Immigration, at the Palais de Porte Dorée, has been redesigned to provide an experience rich in historical documents, works of art, objects and filmed testimonies.

title: France counts cost after rare earthquake hits west
description: There were no fatalities, even though the earthquake was felt as far as Rennes in Brittany in the north and two aftershocks were recorded on Saturday morning.

title: Top 14 final: A clash of coaches between Toulouse and La Rochelle
description: There are few things in common between Ugo Mola and Ronan O'Gara, the coaches of Stade Toulousain and La Rochelle, who will play in the French league's final on Saturday evening in Saint-Denis.

title: Sudan: Over a dozen killed in Khartoum airstrike
description: The dead include five children, as fighting countinues between rival generals seeking to control the northeast African country.

title: Dismantling of Alibaba empire marks end of an era for China
description: The split-up into six subsidiaries of the digital giant founded by Jack Ma is the consequence of a crackdown launched in 2021 by Beijing, which found it too powerful, but also of the end of the unbridled growth of the Chinese economy.

title: Greek MP expelled from Mitsotakis' party over shipwreck comments
description: While condemning the 'tragic' event, with at least 78 migrants killed, Spilios Kriketos added that the European country 'cannot tolerate more migrants.' He was kicked out of the conservative New Democracy Party, which is seeking to regain power.

title: Israel: Community conflict over river access reflects deeper divisions
description: In the north of the country, the residents of a kibbutz located on the banks of the Asi River are disputing with activists demanding the right to enjoy the beaches.

title: French cities prepare to harness and reuse wastewater
description: There is an estimated 8 billion cubic meters of water that could be reused in mainland France, but less than 1% of this volume is being treated for reuse.

title: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic weakened by several weeks of protests
description: The leader of the Balkan country faces diverse opposition forces that focus on his contradictions with regard to the West and the Kosovo conflict.

title: 'What is at stake in Central Asia is the increasing risk of Russia's vassalization to China'
description: Kazakhstan is drawing closer to Beijing to broaden its diplomatic horizons, at the risk of replacing one domination with another, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: The American West faces a new frontier: Climate change
description: In California, Arizona and Utah, populations endure torrential downpours, heatwaves, floods and droughts in a jagged weather pattern that is symptomatic of the climate imbalance to come across the entire planet.

title: Uganda: At least 41 killed in jihadist attack near Congo border
description: The Allied Democratic Forces, who have launched attacks from their base in eastern Congo for years, targeted a secondary school, setting fire to a dormitory and killing students.

title: Germany wants to speed up nuclear fusion
description: Berlin, which has just phased out nuclear power, is due to present a plan by the end of June to step up support for the development of this technology expected to revolutionize the production of low-carbon energy.

title: Macron presents plan to develop less polluting aircraft
description: On Friday, the French president announced a slew of investments to produce the successor to the A320 and create a French biofuel industry.

title: Lyon-Turin rail tunnel exacerbates region's political divisions
description: In the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, tensions were already high between environmentalists and the conservative regional president, Laurent Wauquiez.

title: MBS brings diplomatic offensive to Paris, where interests don't always align
description: On Friday, French President Emmanuel Macron met with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Paris. They discussed the war in Ukraine, Iran and Lebanon.

title: The Lyon-Turin tunnel: What's at stake in this controversial project
description: The decades-old project is supposed to promote rail freight by piercing a tunnel through the Alps, between France and Italy. Opponents are protesting against the costs and environmental consequences this Saturday.

title: Lyon-Turin tunnel: Tension builds ahead of protest
description: A force of 2,000 gendarmes is being deployed to enforce a ban on the demonstration against the piercing of a tunnel through the Alps.

title: Foxes, crows, weasels... The much-criticized list of 'species likely to cause damage' has been updated
description: Nature conservation organizations criticize the method used for this classification, and point to the lack of proof that it is effective in reducing damage attributed to certain species.

title: As summer approaches, heatwaves and megafires are already raging, with the worst yet to come
description: Out-of-control wildfires in Canada, exceptional heat waves in Asia and Puerto Rico, record ocean surface temperatures... Extreme events are gathering pace, and El Niño is set to make things even worse.

title: 'There's no need to run to the gym to slim down before the summer'
description: According to anthropological research, hunter-gatherers and athletes burn no more calories than sedentary Westerners.

title: Italy eases environmental standards to help with the construction of seawater desalination plants
description: The 'drought' decree adopted in March will facilitate desalination activities, currently located primarily on smaller islands.

title: In the Netherlands, the statue of a Black woman polarizes opinions
description: A new sculpture of an anonymous young woman in Rotterdam has sparked both great enthusiasm and passionate debate about the cultural representation of minorities.

title: War in Ukraine: Hundreds of western electronic components found in Russian weapons
description: According to a report, most of the components found in Russian weapons in Ukraine were manufactured by 155 foreign companies. Two-thirds of these were American.
